item.description:
“Nothing will benefit human health and increase chances for survival of life on Earth as much as the evolution to a vegetarian diet.” ~ Albert Einstein

If we are truly what we eat then why are we so often living to eat instead of eating to live? During this unique 3 hour class you'll learn step by step how to create simple, yet delicious meals that are designed to bring quality health and nutrition to your body.

Make it your New Year's Resolution to learn more about the Raw Food Revolution! Even if you're not a vegetarian, join other like-minded people for some delicious food and important health and nutrition tips!

Long term raw food educators Curt and Kristin Griffing will provide a fun evening of education followed by a delicious, nutrition packed feast! During and after the food preparation they will cover a variety of topics. (Questions are ALWAYS welcome and encouraged!) Also, the recipes for everything prepared this evening will be distributed to everyone participating.

Demonstration and dinner will consist of a 5 course raw meal including fresh, organic juice, soup, salad, entree and dessert.

Cost is $35.00/person and we need a definite commitment from at least 10 people to attend! Please send your check to: Raw Food Central, 446 Broad Street, Windsor, CT 06095 (Advance payment is required)

MENU
~ Appetizer ~
Fresh Sweet Organic Carrot Juice

~ Salad ~
The Raw Food Central Big Six Eating to Live Salad with Creamy Craves Cashew Un-Ranch Dressing. This Salad has 6 or more fresh vegetables in it. Organic Romaine lettuce or mixed baby greens, kale, red pepper, cucumber, carrots, and broccoli dressed in a delicious creamy ranch dressing which is entirely dairy free.

~ Soup ~
Creamy Corn Soup ~ A simple yet tasty way to make fresh homemade corn soup that’s so filling and easily hits the spot on cool winter days by using only a few simple ingredients and a blender.

~ Entree ~
Two for One Collard and Marinated Cabbage Wrap ~ Shredded cabbage marinated in a light cold pressed olive oil with choice herbs and spices rolled into a beautiful green collard wrap. A great two for one recipe that teaches simple technique for FAST raw food that is ever so satisfying as a meal in a variety of simple ways.

~ Dessert ~
Stuffed Almond Date Balls ~ a simply delightful dessert made from soft, fresh dates and raw almonds with marinated or spiced fresh organic fruit. Easy, healthy and oh so yummy!


We will be demonstrating the recipes using a variety of techniques that require the use of a knife, cutting board, food processor that can be purchased anywhere (although we do have recommendations for anyone that is looking for either quality or budget friendly options) and a Vitamix blender. (The recipes made in this session can be made using a traditional blender if some of the ingredients are soaked prior to putting the recipe together though results may vary depending on each individual blender.)

group.name: The Ethnic Dining Enthusiasts Meetup Group

item.name: Raw Food Preparation Class & Feast! (1/8/10)
